skill.name: csv-processor
skill.description: Parse, transform, and analyze CSV files with advanced data manipulation capabilities.
skill.summary: Parse, transform, and analyze CSV files with advanced data manipulation capabilities.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It provides CSV processing examples and best practices without any security risks.

content.user_title: Process CSV files with advanced data manipulation
content.value_statement: CSV files often contain messy data that needs cleaning and transformation. This skill provides comprehensive tools and examples for parsing, cleaning, and analyzing CSV data efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Filter, sort, and transform CSV data
Clean data by removing duplicates and handling missing values
Generate statistical summaries and data profiles
Merge multiple CSV files with joins
Split large CSV files into manageable chunks
limitations: Requires external tools (pandas, csv-parser) for execution
Large files may need chunking for memory efficiency
Complex transformations may require custom code
Encoding issues may need manual resolution

use_cases.title: Clean and analyze survey data
use_cases.description: Process raw survey responses, remove invalid entries, calculate statistics, and generate summary reports.

use_cases.title: Transform log files into reports
use_cases.description: Parse application logs in CSV format, filter by time ranges, aggregate metrics, and export cleaned data.

use_cases.title: Merge customer databases
use_cases.description: Combine customer data from multiple CSV sources, remove duplicates, and standardize formats for CRM import.

prompt_templates.title: Basic CSV parsing
prompt_templates.prompt: Parse this CSV file and show me the first 10 rows with column names and data types: [attach CSV file]

prompt_templates.title: Data cleaning
prompt_templates.prompt: Clean this CSV by removing duplicate rows and filling missing values with appropriate defaults: [attach CSV file]

prompt_templates.title: Statistical analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this CSV file and provide summary statistics for all numeric columns, including mean, median, and outliers: [attach CSV file]

prompt_templates.title: Complex transformation
prompt_templates.prompt: Filter this sales data for Q4 2023, group by region, and calculate total revenue and average order value: [attach CSV file]

output_examples.input: Clean this customer database and remove duplicates
output: âœ“ Found and removed 342 duplicate entries based on email
âœ“ Standardized 89 phone numbers to international format
âœ“ Filled 156 missing names with 'Unknown Customer'
âœ“ Cleaned database saved as customers_clean.csv (14,892 rows)

best_practices: Always validate CSV structure and encoding before processing
Test transformations on a small sample before running on full dataset
Keep backups of original files before making changes
anti_patterns: Processing entire large files without chunking
Assuming default delimiter is always comma
Ignoring encoding issues until they cause errors

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports CSV, TSV, and other delimiter-separated formats. It auto-detects delimiters and handles various encodings.

faq.question: Can it handle very large CSV files?
faq.answer: Yes, use chunking for files over 100MB. Process in smaller pieces to avoid memory issues.

faq.question: Does it work with Excel files?
faq.answer: Convert Excel to CSV first using Excel or online converters. The skill focuses on plain text CSV formats.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill provides code examples only. Your data stays local when you run the provided code snippets.

faq.question: What if my CSV has encoding issues?
faq.answer: Try different encodings: UTF-8, Latin-1, Windows-1252. The skill shows how to detect and fix encoding problems.

faq.question: Can I merge multiple CSV files?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides examples for vertical concatenation and SQL-style joins based on common columns.
